content: I appreciate the analysis of this article and the inclusion of the perspectives of Vineyard, but my feeling is the same as Linda Robinson’s after reading the article. My sense is that the answer lies on a continuum between “evangelicals” selling their soles to the devil and an evolution in what “evangelical” really means. 30 years or so the people who now voted for Trump would have been categorized as “Fundamentalists,” NOT “evangelicals.” But I digress. A parallel effort by Michael Gerson of the Washington Post may also be helpful: [Opinion] Under Trump, Christians may have it easier. They’ll also be in grave spiritual danger https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/under-trump-christians-may-have-it-easier-theyll-also-be-in-grave-spiritual-danger/2017/01/23/16cdb6ac-e19e-11e6-a453-19ec4b3d09ba_story.html?utm_term=.b242ddcf33ce
